meanings.sent1: After finishing the cookie, she decided to redip it in the chocolate sauce.
meanings.sent2: He redipped the paintbrush into the can to get more paint.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy chef accidentally redipped his sleeve in the soup while reaching for the salt.
meanings.sent4: She redipped her toes into the cool water, feeling the refreshing sensation once more.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully redipped the brush, ensuring the color was vibrant on the canvas.

meanings.definition: To immerse again in a liquid.
meanings.sent1: She had to redip the cloth in the soapy water to clean the stubborn stain.
meanings.sent2: The child redipped his toy in the bubble solution to create more bubbles.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful swimmer had to redip his toe in the pool to check the water temperature.
meanings.sent4: The explorer redipped his hand into the cold stream, feeling the icy rush once more.
meanings.sent5: The baker had to redip the cake in the glaze for a perfect finish.

meanings.definition: To plunge or thrust into a liquid again.
meanings.sent1: He had to redip the thermometer into the boiling water to get an accurate reading.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman redipped his line into the lake, hoping for a bigger catch.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy redipped his paw into the puddle, splashing water everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The diver redipped his feet into the ocean, feeling the saltwater embrace once more.
meanings.sent5: The gardener had to redip the plant into the nutrient-rich soil for better growth.
